devdoc.details: Based on openzeppelin's burnable and mintable ERC20 tokens

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params.owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: The address to query the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: A uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

burn(uint256).details: Burns a specific amount of tokens.

params.value: The amount of token to be burned.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Burns a specific amount of tokens from the target address and decrements allowance.

params.from: address The account whose tokens will be burned.
params.value: uint256 The amount of token to be burned.

calcContribution(uint256,uint256,uint256.details: Percentage to x dp as defined by contributionFeeDecimals e.g. when contributionFeeDecimals is 2, 1200 is 12.00%

calcDecay(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint25.return: Number of tokens decayed since last transaction

calcFeesIncContribution(uint256,uint256).details: Percentage to x dp as defined by contributionFeeDecimals e.g. when contributionFeeDecimals is 2, 1200 is 12.00%
calcFeesIncContribution(uint256,uint256).return: Tokens to cover fees, inclusive of contribution

calcFeesToBurn(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Percentage to x dp as defined by contributionFeeDecimals e.g. when contributionFeeDecimals is 2, 1200 is 12.00%

calcGeneration(uint256,uint256,uint256,u.details: This function contains a for loop, so in theory may fail for accounts that have been inactive for an extremely long time. These accounts will have zero balance anyway.

calcNumCompletedPeriods(uint256,uint256,.return: The number of completed periods since last generation block

decimals().return: the number of decimals of the token.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.subtractedValue: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

getGenerationAmount().return: Number of tokens issued during generation

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.addedValue: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.

params.to: The address that will receive the minted tokens.
params.value: The amount of tokens to mint.

mint(address,uint256).return: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

totalSupply().details: Total number of tokens in existence.

verifyAccount(address).details: New accounts can always be created. This function can't be disabled.

approveAccount(address).notice: //////////////Approve the specified account to receive generation

calcContribution(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: Calculate the contribution due. Contribution is a percentage taken from the fee

calcDecay(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: Calculate the number of tokens decayed since the last transaction

calcFeesIncContribution(uint256,uint256).notice: Calculate the total amount allocated for both fees and contribution Contribution % is not relavent as contributiones are taken from the fee

calcFeesToBurn(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculate fees to burn. This is the fee % minus the contribution due

calcGeneration(uint256,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Calculate the generation accrued since the last generation period

calcNumCompletedPeriods(uint256,uint256,.notice: Calculate the number of generation periods since the last generation block

calcZeroBlock(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Calculate the block at which the balance for this account will be zero

getDecayedBalance(address).notice: Return the balance including decay up to the current block, but ignoring any accrued generation

getGenerationAmount().notice: Get the number of tokens issued to each account after each generation period

liveBalanceOf(address).notice: Return the real balance of the account, as of this block

mine().notice: For testing purposes, manually mine a block to simulate the passing of time

terminateCurrency(bool,address).notice: Delete the contract. Only use for testing.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfer the currency from one account to another, updating each account to reflect the time passed, and the effects of the transfer

triggerOnchainBalanceUpdate(address).notice: Manually trigger an onchain update of the live balance

unapproveAccount(address).notice: Unapprove the specified account so that it no longer receives generation

updateCommunityContribution(uint256).notice: Set the contribution percentage, to be taken from the fee %

updateCommunityContributionAccount(addre.notice: //////////////Set the address that the contribution will be sent to

updateGenerationAmount(uint256).notice: Update the number of tokens issued to each account after each generation period

updateGenerationPeriod(uint256).notice: Update the number of blocks between each generation period

updateInitialBalance(uint256).notice: Update the balance issued to an account on creation

updateLifetime(uint256).notice: //////////////Update the lifetime for this currency. (The number of blocks after which a balance decays to zero)

updateTransactionFee(uint256).notice: Set the fee %, to be taken from every transaction

verifyAccount(address).notice: Create a new account with the specified role

userdoc.notice: One contract is deployed for each community
